Module: Universal

All functions provided by Universal node. Universal modes server all but commands related to groups and player.
Since:
  • 2020-11-08
Author:
  • Henning Klages
Source:
  • sonos-universal.js, line 18

Methods

(async, inner) coordinatorDelegateCoordination(node, msg, msg[stateName, stateName, cmdName, sonosPlayer)

Coordinator delegate coordination of group. New player must be in same group!
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
node object not used
msg object incoming message
msg[stateName string name of new coordinator - must be in same group as player and different!
msg.playerName string <optional>
 SONOS player name - if missing uses sonosPlayer - must be coordinator
stateName string default: payload - in compatibility mode: topic
cmdName string not used
sonosPlayer object Sonos player - as default and anchor player
Source:
  • sonos-universal.js, line 266
Throws:
any functions throws error and explicit throws

(async, inner) groupPlay(node, msg, stateName, cmdName, sonosPlayer)

Starts playing content. Content must have been set before.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
node object not used
msg object incoming message
Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
volume number/string <optional>
 volume - if missing do not touch volume
sameVolume number <optional>
 shall all players play at same volume level. If missing all group members play at same volume level
playerName string <optional>
 SONOS player name - if missing uses sonosPlayer
stateName string not used
cmdName string not used
sonosPlayer object Sonos player - as default and anchor player
Source:
  • sonos-universal.js, line 865
Throws:
any functions throws error and explicit throws

(async, inner) groupPlayExport(node, msg, msg[stateName, stateName:, cmdName, sonosPlayer)

Play data being exported form My Sonos (uri/metadata) on a given group of players
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
node object not used
msg object incoming message
msg[stateName string content to be played
msg[stateName].uri string uri to be played/queued
msg[stateName].queue boolean indicator: has to be queued
msg[stateName].metadata string <optional>
 metadata in case of queue = true
msg.volume number/string <optional>
 volume - if missing do not touch volume
msg.sameVolume boolean <optional>
 shall all players play at same volume level. If missing all group members play at same volume level
msg.clearQueue boolean <optional>
 if true and export.queue = true the queue is cleared. Default is true.
msg.playerName string <optional>
 SONOS player name - if missing uses sonosPlayer
stateName: string payload - in compatibility mode: topic
cmdName string not used
sonosPlayer object Sonos player - as default and anchor player
Source:
  • sonos-universal.js, line 912
Throws:
any functions throws error and explicit throws

(async, inner) groupPlayNotification(node, msg, msg[stateName, stateName, cmdName, sonosPlayer)

Play notification on a given group of players. Group topology will not being touched.
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
node object only used for debug and warning
msg object incoming message
msg[stateName string notification uri.
msg.volume number/string <optional>
 volume - if missing do not touch volume
msg.sameVolume boolean <optional>
 shall all players play at same volume level. If missing all group members play at same volume level
msg.playerName string <optional>
 SONOS player name - if missing uses sonosPlayer
msg.duration string <optional>
 duration of notification hh:mm:ss - default is calculation, if that fails then 00:00:05
stateName string default: payload - in compatibility mode: topic
cmdName string not used
sonosPlayer object Sonos player
Source:
  • sonos-universal.js, line 979
Throws:
any functions throws error and explicit throws Hint: While playing a notification (start .. to end + 2 seconds) there should not be send another request to this group.

(async, inner) groupPlayStreamHttpV2(node, msg, stateName, cmdName, sonosPlayer)

Plays stream using http such as http://www.fritz.de/live.m3u, https://live.radioarabella.de
Parameters:
Name Type Default Description
node object not used
msg object incoming message
Properties
Name Type Attributes Default Description
payload* string valid uri starting with http:// or https:// (*: compatibility mode: topic)
volume number | string <optional>
 unchanged new volume
sameVolume boolean <optional>
 true force all players to play at same volume level.
playerName string <optional>
 using sonosPlayer SONOS-Playername. Overrules sonosPlayer
stateName string payload in compatibility mode: topic
cmdName string topic in compatibility mode: payload
sonosPlayer object Sonos player from config node
Source:
  • sonos-universal.js, line 1129
Throws:
  • if msg.sameValue true and standalone player
    Type
    error
  • NRCSP error from methods validatedGroupProperties, getGroupMemberDataV2, stringValidRegex
    Type
    error
  • from node-sonos setAVTransportURI and setVolume
    Type
    error

(async, inner) groupPlayTrack(node, msg, msg[stateName, stateName, cmdName, sonosPlayer)

Play a specific track in queue. Queue must not be empty.

msg object incoming message

 shall all players play at same volume level. If missing all group members play at same volume level

 SONOS player name - if missing uses sonosPlayer

Play notification on a joiner (in group) specified by sonosPlayer (default) or by playerName.
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
node object only used for debug and warning
msg object incoming message
msg[stateName string notification uri.
msg.volume number/string <optional>
 volume - if missing do not touch volume
msg.duration string <optional>
 duration of notification hh:mm:ss - default is calculation, if that fails then 00:00:05

 SONOS player name - if missing uses sonosPlayer
stateName string default: payload - in compatibility mode: topic
cmdName string not used
sonosPlayer object Sonos player

Validate sonos player object, command and dispatch further.

Name Type Description

config object current node configuration
Properties
Name Type Description

state string the state from node dialog
compatibilityMode boolean tic from node dialog
msg object incoming message
ipaddress string IP address of sonos player Creates also msg.nrcspCmd because in compatibility mode all get commands overwrite msg.payload (the command)

(async, inner) validatedGroupProperties(msg, pkgPrefix)

Validates group properties msg.playerName, msg.volume, msg.sameVolume, msg.clearQueue
Parameters:
Name Type Description
msg object incoming message
Properties
Name Type Attributes Default Description
playerName string <optional>
 '' playerName
volume string/number <optional>
 -1 volume. if not set don't touch original volume.
sameVolume boolean <optional>
 true sameVolume
clearQueue boolean <optional>
 true indicator for clear queue
pkgPrefix string package identifier
Source:
  • sonos-universal.js, line 2845
Throws:
error for all invalid values

Type Definitions

GroupMember

Group member data.
Type:
  • Object
Properties:
Name Type Default Description
urlHostname string hostname such as "192.168.178.35"
urlPort number 1400 port
baseUrl string base url such as "http://192.167.178.35:1400"
uuid string such as "RINCON_000E58FE3AEA01400"
sonosName string SONOS-Playername such as "Bad"
invisible boolean is invisible (example: stereo pair)
Source:
  • sonos-universal.js, line 485
